name: ampliseq-16s
title: 16S Bacterial Community Profiling
description: Characterize bacterial communities from 16S rRNA amplicon sequencing data. This pipeline performs quality control, denoising with DADA2, taxonomic classification using SILVA database, and generates diversity metrics and visualizations for microbiome analysis.
content:
Introduction

The nf-core/ampliseq pipeline is a bioinformatics analysis workflow designed for 16S rRNA amplicon sequencing data. This application is specifically configured for bacterial community profiling using the SILVA taxonomic database.

Pipeline Overview

Key Features

  • Quality control and adapter trimming

  • ASV inference using DADA2

  • Taxonomic classification with SILVA database

  • Alpha and beta diversity analysis

  • Phylogenetic tree construction

  • Interactive visualization reports

Typical Workflow

  1. Read quality control (FastQC)

  2. Primer trimming (Cutadapt)

  3. ASV inference and denoising (DADA2)

  4. Taxonomic classification (SILVA)

  5. Diversity metrics (QIIME2)

  6. Comprehensive QC report (MultiQC)

Note: This pipeline is optimized for bacterial 16S rRNA gene sequencing using common primer sets (V3-V4, V4 regions). SILVA database is automatically downloaded and used for taxonomic assignments.
